active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between broad authorization boundaries (simpler management but higher risk) and granular microsegmentation (enhanced security but increased complexity). Use the SolarWinds breach as a real-world example to support your arguments.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Generate 40 high-quality flashcards on 'Logical Security Boundaries' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Secure Design Principles > Security Architecture Principles > Boundary and Isolation Design > Logical Security Boundaries). **Content Context:** Use this comprehensive summary: - Big Picture: Logical boundaries (software/config-based) reduce attack surface, enable ZTA, ensure compliance (NIST SP 800-53 AC-4/SC-7). - Definitions: Authorization Boundary (NIST SP 800-37: scope of protection); Segmentation (VLANs/firewalls); Microsegmentation (workload-level, NIST SP 1800-35); ZTA (never trust, always verify). - Prior Knowledge: Firewalls, VLANs, ACLs, physical boundaries. - Scaffolding: [Insert full scaffolding from above]. - Learning Objectives: [Insert full objectives from above]. - Active Learning Examples: Incorporate discussion/peer teaching/problems into card explanations. - Sources: NIST SP 800-37r2, NIST SP 800-53 (AC-4, SC-7), NIST SP 1800-35, CIS Controls; SolarWinds case study. **Output Format:** JSON array of objects, each: {'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'reference': '...'}}. Follow flashcard_schema exactly. **Generation Rules:** - Cover all Bloom's levels per objectives (at least 6-8 cards each). - Distribute across scaffolding layers. - MCQs: 70% (4 options, 1 correct); others: short answer/cloze. - Distractors: Follow protocol (misconceptions, similar concepts, extremes). - Explanations: 2-4 sentences, pedagogical (link to objectives/active learning), engaging. - Ensure completeness, voter priorities (NIST full, case studies), no hallucinations.
